Old-school tactile switches

Hector uses pleasantly tactile switches and knobs. Every flipswitch has a satisfying feel, and the volume knob is endlessly smooth. All of them are made entirely of metal, and are labelled with laser-engraved symbols in the wood.



Complementary screw colors

Any color of finish you choose will come with a set of screws in a complementary color; Chrome screws for the light stain, gold screws for the dark stain, black screws for the black painted.



guitar strap

Hector comes with a high quality synthetic leather guitar strap, making it wearable for easy portability. The all-metal strap hooks make the strap easily removable and/or replacable. Placement of the strap has been carefully calulated for ergonomic comfort.






High-fidelity speaker drivers

Hector uses 6 full-size hi-fi drivers from Dayton Audio. The four woofers and two tweeters are divided into two discrete cabinets, in order to eliminate destructive interference within the speaker.




110dB @ 10THD

So, how loud is it? Only one way to say it: Hector goes LOUD. A regular vacuum cleaner is about 70dB. Roskilde Festival allows up to 100dB for their concerts. Hector can easily play 110dB.




Optimal linear response

Hector uses the powerful Class-D Max-amp from Accusafe, along with a pair of second order crossover filters, at 12dB/oct, making the sound extremely unbiased across frequencies.











kr. 3500,-

free shipping to Denmark



Product ships June 1st.


About Polydecibel

Polydecibel Audio I/S is a Copenhagen-based hi-fi audio company founded by three music, business and engineering students. The company was created with the express purpose of creating a better social speaker. This is HECTOR.

To this day, Polydecibel Audio systems are still built individually by hand in Copenhagen, by Copenhageners.

Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.
